result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian Z. Rossell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Absolute sobriety.
No contact with victim L.P.

Complete SAFE program or its equivalent.
Assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.
Assessment, treatment, and counseling through Veterans Admin if deemed appropriate by dept.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 11:06am
State appears by ADA M.Puerner.  Def appears in person/in custody and with Atty Kat Jackan.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW - victim impact statement filed.

State moves to:
Ct. 1 (Strangulation/Suffocation/DA)>>D&RI
Ct. 3 (Intimidate Victim/Attempt Force/DA)>>D&RI
Ct. 4 (Battery/DA)>>D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA: 
Ct. 2 (False Imprisonment/DA)>>NO CONTEST
Ct. 5 (DC/DA)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held; 3 years Probation on each count concurrent
CONDITIONS: On Ct. 2 only--5 months MCJ w/huber for treatment if defendant qualifies under jail classification system w/credit for 124 days of time already served; Complete Safe program or its equivalent; Absolute sobriety; N/C w/victim L.P.; Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO, including AODA and/or mental health assessment/treatment/counseling through veterans administration if deemed appropriate by dept; CC including 2 domestic abuse surcharges.

and Certificate of Appearance (subpoena mailed to J.R.A. 10/21/14)
in Limine
Pre-trial conference on October 24, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 9:33am
State appears by ADA M.Puerner; Defendant appears in person/in custody and with Attorney Kat Jackan.
(MIL/FPT)

State notes both parties have filed MIL.
COURT takes up defense MIL first - State agress to 1-5, 7-11, 14-18, 21-23; COURT grants those MIL as filed by Attorney Jackan
COURT questions parties regarding #6 - Arguments by parties; COURT makes rulings on #6 regarding pictures - State to advise Atty Jackan by end of today which photos will be used.
COURT questions parties re: #12 - State notes agreement as to specific contact, and argument by Atty Jackan; COURT makes rulings on #12.
COURT questions parties re: #13 - State makes argument on term "victim" and argument by Atty Jackan; COURT makes rulings on #13.
COURT questions parties re: #19 - State notes Officer Cornell would be only witness present at counsel table for trial and argument by Atty Jackan; COURT makes rulings
COURT questions parties re:#20 - State notes argument; certified medical records have been provided to defense in accordance with 40 day rule; Argument by Atty Jackan; COURT makes rulings. Def MIL are concluded

COURT takes up State's MIL - Atty Jackan agrees to all except #9 - COURT questions Atty jackan re: any Miranda/Goodchild issues; Atty Jackan states argument.
COURT will make record prior to start of trial regarding defendant's nonacceptance of the final written offer by State.
Atty Jackan makes argument on #9 - COURT notes information regarding exactly what it going to be used and will be needed for ruling.

COURT received Motion re: D.A. enhancer today - COURT notes issue ts for tryer of fact; Both parties state agreement that it is for the COURT to make decision after conviction; State to find statute number and COURT reserves ruling on this issue until trial.

Adj: 9:58am
to Dismiss Domestic Abuse Enhancer - stj
Defendant's - stj
Notice of Motion and Motion in Limine - stj
and Demand for Discovery and Inspection
Defendant's - stj
Jury Trial on November 6, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Motion hearing on October 13, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 19, 2014 at 09:30 am.
FPT / JT set

No contact whatsoever with victim(s): L.P.    Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Under 969.03 signature bond only goes into effect when VA liason picks up defendant from Marathon County jail and transports to VA hospital; Defendant must remain inpatient at VA and at any time that would terminate, before defendant is released from VA, there must be a hearing before the COURT to determine bond (defendant may appear by phone).

Court excuses defendant from pretrial conference set for August.

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 2:21pm
State appears by ADA M.Puerner; Defendant appears in person*/in custody and with Attorney Kat Jackan

State notes defendant has set up VA hospital inpatient treatment and is now requesting bond modification - Atty Jackan notes inpatient treatment has been set up but does not know how long the treatment will last, and transport by VA is available to VA hospital.
COURT questions if VA liason will transport back to Marathon County - Atty Jackan is not sure of the arrangements that would be available.

Argument by State on bond modification - defendant can be placed in custody at VA and not be able to voluntarily leave, and when treatment is complete, that defendant must be transported back to MCJ.

COURT converts $10,000 cash bond to $10,000 sign bond under following conditions -  Under 969.03 signature bond only goes into effect when VA liason picks up defendant from Marathon County jail and transports to VA hospital; Defendant must remain inpatient at VA and at any time that would terminate, before defendant is released from VA, there must be a hearing before the COURT to determine bond (def may appear by phone).  N/C w/L.P. (victim) whatsoever.

COURT excuses def from PTC set for August.
Sent to Judge
Probable Cause Found

Case called: 9:32am.  Clerk: Denise. State appears by ADA Michael Puerner. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty Kat Jackan. State makes statement re: Defendant returning from hospital today to the jail. Crt questions Atty Jackan re: Defendant's clear mind today. Crt addresses Defendant. Defendant makes statement. Crt proceeds with Prelim. WSPD Jerrick Alsteen sworn & testifies- identifies defendant. Arguments. Crt finds probable cause & binds defendant over for arraignment and trial. State moves for 30 days to file Information - crt grants. Bond to Continue. DATES: PTC 8/16/14 @ 8:50am. CC: BR 4. Adjourned: 9:47am.
Defendant's
Pre-trial conference on August 14, 2014 at 08:50 am.
Preliminary Hearing on July 16, 2014 at 09:20 am.

Absolute sobriety.   No contact with victim(s): L.P. (NON WAIVABLE). Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. WPD Police escort to retrieve any personal belongings. If defendant arranges for in-patient at VA court will set hearing on bond if defendant requests.
